Returns: this @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#model#GroundOverlayOptions_E@ object with a new position set.
Parameters: @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#model#LatLngBounds_E@
a @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#model#LatLngBounds_E@ in which to place the ground overlay
Throws: if the position was already set using @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#model#GroundOverlayOptions#position_E@ or @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#model#GroundOverlayOptions#position_E@
positionFromBounds(com.google.android.gm.Description: Specifies the position for this ground overlay. When rendered, the image will be scaled to fit the bounds (i.e., its proportions will not necessarily be preserved).

Returns: this @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#model#GroundOverlayOptions_E@ object with a new image set.
Parameters: @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#model#BitmapDescriptor_E@
the @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#model#BitmapDescriptor_E@ to use for this ground overlay
image(com.google.android.gms.maps.model..Description: Specifies the image for this ground overlay. To load an image as a texture (which is used to draw the image on a map), it must be converted into an image with sides that are powers of two. This is so that a mipmap can be created in order to render the texture at various zoom levels - see

Returns: this @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#model#GroundOverlayOptions_E@ object with a new visibility setting.
visible(boolean).Description: Specifies the visibility for the ground overlay. The default visibility is true.

Returns: this @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#model#GroundOverlayOptions_E@ object with a new bearing set.
Parameters: float
the bearing in degrees clockwise from north. Values outside the range [0, 360) will be normalized.
bearing(float).Description: Specifies the bearing of the ground overlay in degrees clockwise from north. The rotation is performed about the anchor point. If not specified, the default is 0 (i.e., up on the image points north). If a ground overlay with position set using @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#model#GroundOverlayOptions#positionFromBounds_E@ is rotated, its size will preserved and it will no longer be guaranteed to fit inside the bounds.

Returns: true if the ground overlay is to be visible; false if it is not.
isVisible().Description: Gets the visibility setting for this options object.

Returns: the v value of the anchor.
getAnchorV().Description: Vertical distance, normalized to [0, 1], of the anchor from the top edge.

Returns: the u value of the anchor.
getAnchorU().Description: Horizontal distance, normalized to [0, 1], of the anchor from the left edge.

writeToParcel(android.os.Parcel, int).FullName: public void writeToParcel (Parcel out, int flags)

Returns: this @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#model#GroundOverlayOptions_E@ object with a new zIndex set.
zIndex(float).Description: Specifies the ground overlay's zIndex, i.e., the order in which it will be drawn. See the documentation at the top of this class for more information about zIndex.

Returns: the bearing of the ground overlay.
getBearing().Description: Gets the bearing set for this options object.

Returns: this @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#model#GroundOverlayOptions_E@ object with a new anchor set.
Parameters: float
u-coordinate of the anchor, as a ratio of the image width (in the range [0, 1])
float
v-coordinate of the anchor, as a ratio of the image height (in the range [0, 1])
anchor(float, float).Description: Specifies the anchor to be at a particular point in the image. The anchor specifies the point in the image that aligns with the ground overlay's location. The anchor point is specified in the continuous space [0.0, 1.0] x [0.0, 1.0], where (0, 0) is the top-left corner of the image, and (1, 1) is the bottom-right corner.
anchor(float, float).FullName: public GroundOverlayOptions anchor (float u, float v)

Returns: this @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#model#GroundOverlayOptions_E@ object with a new position set.
Parameters: @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#model#LatLng_E@

the location on the map @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#model#LatLng_E@ to which the anchor point in the given image will remain fixed. The anchor will remain fixed to the position on the ground when transformations are applied (e.g., setDimensions, setBearing, etc.).
float
the width of the overlay (in meters)
float
the height of the overlay (in meters)
Throws: if width or height are negative
if the position was already set using @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#model#GroundOverlayOptions#positionFromBounds_E@
position(com.google.android.gms.maps.mod.Description: Specifies the position for this ground overlay using an anchor point (a @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#model#LatLng_E@), width and height (both in meters). When rendered, the image will be scaled to fit the dimensions specified (i.e., its proportions will not necessarily be preserved).
position(com.google.android.gms.maps.mod.FullName: public GroundOverlayOptions position (LatLng location, float width, float height)

GroundOverlayOptions().Description: Creates a new set of ground overlay options.

Returns: the height of the ground overlay.
getHeight().Description: Gets the height set for this options object.

Returns: this @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#model#GroundOverlayOptions_E@ object with a new position set.
Parameters: @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#model#LatLng_E@

the location on the map @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#model#LatLng_E@ to which the anchor point in the given image will remain fixed. The anchor will remain fixed to the position on the ground when transformations are applied (e.g., setDimensions, setBearing, etc.).
float
the width of the overlay (in meters). The height will be determined automatically based on the image proportions.
Throws: if the position was already set using @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#model#GroundOverlayOptions#positionFromBounds_E@
position(com.google.android.gms.maps.mod.Description: Specifies the position for this ground overlay using an anchor point (a @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#model#LatLng_E@) and the width (in meters). When rendered, the image will retain its proportions from the bitmap, i.e., the height will be calculated to preserve the original proportions of the image.

Returns: the image of the ground overlay.
getImage().Description: Gets the image set for this options object.

getLocation().Description: Gets the location set for this options object.

Returns: this @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#model#GroundOverlayOptions_E@ object with a new visibility setting.
Parameters: float
a float in the range [0..1] where 0 means that the ground overlay is opaque and 1 means that the ground overlay is transparent
Throws: if the transparency is outside the range [0..1].
transparency(float).Description: Specifies the transparency of the ground overlay. The default transparency is 0 (opaque).

getWidth().Description: Gets the width set for this options object.

getTransparency().Description: Gets the transparency set for this options object.

ClassDesc: Defines options for a ground overlay.
